recipe_text: Measurement; 28; Measure out 28 grams of butter| Measurement; 150; Measure out 150 grams of onion, chopped| Measurement; 100; Measure out 100 grams of green bell pepper, chopped| Measurement; 100; Measure out 100 grams of celery, chopped| Measurement; 10; Measure out 10 grams of garlic, minced| Measurement; 400; Measure out 400 grams of tomatoes, chopped| Measurement; 480; Measure out 480 grams of chicken broth| Measurement; 60; Measure out 60 grams of tomato paste| Measurement; 2; Measure out 2 grams of bay leaves| Measurement; 2; Measure out 2 grams of dried thyme| Measurement; 2; Measure out 2 grams of dried basil| Measurement; 5; Measure out 5 grams of salt| Measurement; 2; Measure out 2 grams of black pepper| Measurement; 1; Measure out 1 gram of cayenne pepper| Measurement; 450; Measure out 450 grams of shrimp, peeled and deveined| Measurement; 200; Measure out 200 grams of crabmeat| Untimed; None; Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat| Untimed; None; Add onion, green bell pepper, celery, and garlic to the pot and cook until softened| Untimed; None; Stir in tomatoes, chicken broth, tomato paste, bay leaves, thyme, basil, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper| Untimed; None; Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer| Timed; 1200; Simmer for 20 minutes| Untimed; None; Add shrimp and crabmeat to the pot| Untimed; None; Cook until shrimp are pink and cooked through| Finish; None; Serve hot over rice or with crusty bread!
title: Seafood Creole
